sec.title: Nicholas Copeland
sec.p: is a political anthropologist whose book, The Democracy Development Machine (Cornell University Press, 2019), examines how violent forms of development extend counterinsurgency through electoral democracy in Guatemalan Mayan communities. He currently studies the significance of water and community water science in Indigenous environmental movements against extractive industries.
